Title: Drainage Asset Mapping
Description: A Drainage Asset Survey is required to improve knowledge of the location and condition of highway drainage in Wigan Borough. This will specifically require locating and mapping gully connections and any other pipes in order to show how the gullies in the survey area connect to known drainage infrastructure; the provision of CCTV survey reports and footage of these gully connection pipes according to the WRc Manual of Sewer Classification; hydraulically cleaning all pipework and gullies prior to the survey; and undertaking any traffic management in support of these tasks. The contract will also require the accurate recording of all work and any variations or additions to the inventory supplied using a software mapping system, the maintenance and development of the system during the period of the contract, and the provision of access to the data for a period of 36 months following the completion of the 12 month contract period.
Additional Text: A Drainage Asset Survey is required to improve knowledge of the location and condition of highway drainage in Wigan Borough. The contract will also require the accurate recording of all work and any variations or additions to the inventory supplied using a software mapping system, the maintenance and development of the system during the period of the contract, and the provision of access to the data for a period of 36 months following the completion of the 12 month contract period.

Title: MCEN_001 Connect Housing Repairs and Maintenance Contracts
Description:
Connect Housing Association (the Employer) is a community benefit society providing over 3,000 social housing properties grouped and pepper potted across the whole of West Yorkshire for a variety of different types of households The Employer requires 3 contractors per Lot as detailed below to undertake repairs and maintenance contracts with the primary purpose to provide additional capacity to the Employer's Direct Labour Organisation (DLO). Tenderers may bid for any number of lots providing they employ suitably qualified tradesmen and do not subcontract any of the work without specific approval of the Employer.

Lot 2 - Roofing and Roofline Works 
Lot 3 - Electrical Works 
Lot 4 - Damp and Timber Treatment Works 
Lot 5 - Drainage Works 
Lot 6 - Void Cleaning Works
The Employer does not guarantee any predetermined levels of work and successful contractors may get some, all or none of the work which becomes necessary.

Title: 378_20 Hazardous & Specialist Waste Services (including Site Clearances)
Description:
An ESPO national framework for the provision of hazardous and specialist waste services including the collection and disposal of hazardous waste, bulk specialist wastes, liquid waste and oil, and waste from site clearances. 

Lot 1: Collection and Disposal of Hazardous Waste - Collection and disposal of a range of hazardous wastes including, but not limited to, acids, alkaline batteries, battery acid, cleaning chemicals, laboratory chemicals, fluorescent tubes, aerosols, duplicator fluids, flammable solids and liquids, oils, WEEE, toxics, toxic solids and water-based waste.

Lot 2:  Collection and Disposal of Specialist Waste Streams (dry mixed waste, green waste, wood waste and hardcore /rubble waste) - Collection and disposal of a range of waste streams including, but not limited to, dry mixed waste, green waste, wood waste, and hardcore / rubble waste.

Lot 3: Collection and Disposal of Liquid Waste and Oil - Collection and disposal of a range of liquid wastes including, but not limited to, waste oil, contaminated water, cesspit waste, waste from drainage interceptors and sludge waste.

Lot 4: Collection and Disposal of Waste from Site Clearances (including furniture) - Collection and disposal of a range of wastes resulting from site, buildings and facilities clearances. These wastes may include, but not be limited to, dry mixed waste, recyclables and furniture.

The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 24 months. The total estimated value stated includes the option period.

An eAuction process may be used to award subsequent call off contracts following the reopening of competition among the parties to the Framework Agreement.

As a Central Purchasing Body as defined by the EU Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU, the Framework Agreement is open for use by Public Bodies (defined at https://www.espo.org/ESPO/media/Documents/FAQs/ESPO-s_powers_to_trade__website_-2016-12-22.pdf) that also fall into one of the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of the UK: Local Authorities; Educational Establishments (including Academies); Central Government Departments and Agencies; Police, Fire & Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services; NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services; Registered Charities; Registered Social Landlords; The Corporate Office of the House of Lords, The Corporate Officer of the House of Commons; or any public body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament. Details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas are available at: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281%29/FAQs/Legal

To tender: (a) Go to www.eastmidstenders.org, (b) Register (c) Search for tender opportunity '378_20' d) Express an interest (e) Download the tender from the website.

Please note:  the closing date/time for submission of tenders is 12:00 midday, 12/05/2020.
Additional Text:
The following information is applicable to all lots: ESPO has established a commercial trading company, ESPO Trading Limited, whose target clients are third sector organisations such as national and local charities, public sector mutual organisations and other organisations involved in the delivery of services to or for the public sector. The successful Supplier may be asked to enter into an additional separate framework agreement (the Second Framework) with ESPO Trading Limited on materially similar terms to that found in the tender pack to be entered into by ESPO itself.
Any Second Framework agreement will be a purely commercial agreement and will, for the avoidance of doubt, not be governed by the Public Contract Regulations 2015 or other public procurement legislation. ESPO Trading Limited may enter into the second framework agreement with the successful supplier and make it available to third sector clients who themselves are not required to follow the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 or other public procurement legislation. Accordingly, this is provided for bidders' information only.

To tender: (a) Go to www.eastmidstenders.org, (b) Register (c) Search for tender opportunity '378_20' d) Express an interest (e) Download the tender from the website.

Please note:  the closing date/time for submission of tenders is 12:00 midday, 13/03/2020.

Title: Drain and Gully Clearance 2019
Description: Bradford Metropolitan District Council has a statutory responsibility to keep the highways clear.  As part of this work there is a requirement to clean, repair and maintain various drains and gullies.  Please note that the Council has two main depots responsible for this work in the area, one in Bradford and one at Keighley.  Orders for work could come from either of these depots.  The volume of work cannot be guaranteed as it can result from adverse weather conditions and accidental damage as well as normal wear and tear.  In the last 12 months there have been 75 days of drainage work.  Of these the majority  (approximately 85%) are for work using the larger Jet Vac appliance.  The Council requires a contractor who has experience of cleaning / clearing, repairing and maintaining drains and gullies.  The supplier must have experience in using a high volume jet vac combination unit and a jetting machine / van jetter.  Bidders should note that whilst both types of machine are used the majority of the work involves the use of the larger Jet Vac appliance. Please see the documents on the Council's e tendering website YORtender (www.yortender.co.uk) under reference DN444152 for full details of the requirement and of how to apply.

Title: Drainage Framework
Description:
Efficiency East Midlands (EEM Ltd) is a procurement consortium which establishes and manages a range of framework agreements and dynamic purchasing systems. Our members include social housing providers, local authorities, universities, academy trusts, NHS trusts and regional police forces. 
EEM procured and entered into a framework agreement with multiple contractors for the provision of drainage services. This framework was tendered and awarded based on the following lots:
Lot 1: Drainage Services (Midlands)
Lot 2: Drainage Services (South West)
Lot 3: Drainage Services (London and the South East)
Lot 4: Drainage Services (National Coverage)

Contractors appointed to the framework and any subsequent call off contracts will be responsible for ensuring Contracting Authorities drainage systems are maintained at optimum condition and in accordance with manufacturer's instructions, installer recommendations, Water Authority Standards , recommended codes of practice and all relevant statutory obligations.

Contractors will be expected to provide drainage services to both standard/domestic building drainage and commercial waste. The framework will cover the following drainage works which may be enhanced or refined by Contracting Authorities under their call off process.

•	Reactive service for drain unblocking and jetting 
•	Improving and upgrading drainage systems 
•	Planned maintenance
•	Soil stack and waste pipe unblocking 
•	CCTV drain surveys and reports 
•	Drain repairs including patch repair
•	Pipe re-rounding
•	Root cutting
•	Drain re-lining 
•	Cesspit and Septic Tank emptying, cleaning, unblocking and repairing
•	Interceptor inspections and waste removal
•	Grease trap emptying and cleaning 
•	Renew and rebed manhole covers and slabs
•	Drain and Mnahole inspection and testing
•	Gutter cleaning and clearance
•	Any additional tasks needed in association with the above works
Additional Text:
This framework has been procured by Efficiency East Midlands (EEM Ltd) on behalf of our membership and the other organisations described below as being authorised users. The following contracting authorities will be entitled to agree and award contract under this framework agreement:
1) Any member of EEM which for the avoidance of doubt currently includes 3 partner consortia: Westworks, Advantage South West and South East Consortium. A full list of current EEM members is available at www.eem.org.uk
2) Any future member of EEM or our partner consortia and in all cases being an organisation which has applied to join EEM or our partner consortia in accordance with the applicable constitutional documents;
3) An EEM participant being an organisation which is neither a current or EEM member (as defined at 1 above) nor a future member of EEM (as defined at 2 above) based within England and Wales which owns and/or maintains/manages housing stock in 1 or more geographic area in which it operates and/or is an NHS Trust (which includes Acute Trusts, Care Service Trusts and Ambulance Trusts) or organisation, police authority, fire authority, ambulance trust, universities higher education, further education college, school academy or other public sector organisation.

Title: Reactive Maintenance Framework: Drainage 2019
Description:
The Scope of the Reactive Maintenance Framework: Drainage 2019 (the Framework) is reactive maintenance and associated work (E.g. call out to attend main drain blockage requiring rodding) to the Client's own properties and to properties of Customers. The Customer work is to generate income for the Client so that it may subsidise its public service commitments.

The Client intends to appoint up to 4 (four) Suppliers to each lot of the Framework.

The Client proposes to make this Framework available to eligible contracting authorities and charities within the geographic regions of: Leicestershire (Lot 1 - Leicestershire), Derbyshire, Northamptonshire, Nottinghamshire and Rutland (Lot 2 - The East Midlands) and Staffordshire, Warwickshire and West Midlands (Lot 3 - The West Midlands)

The Framework is intended to be used by the Client or eligible contracting authorities (the Customers) that it grants access. The Customers can include but are not limited to schools, academies, universities, district councils, county councils, city councils, libraries, police forces, fire brigades and charities or similar organisations.

It is not possible to ascertain the precise value which may be generated via the Client and Customers. However, based on the financial year 17/18 the Client's spend was £50,000. The value may increase as a result of the following:

a) the Client increasing its own Client/Property portfolio
b) budgets made available to the Client
c) successful Joint Bidding defined in 2.4
d) where new Customer's call off from the Framework
e) the Client experiences consecutive failures across several sites resulting in a higher volume of call outs

It is anticipated that the majority of Work Orders for the Client will be in the range of £0 to £5,000.

The anticipated framework commencement date is 28.1.2020 for an initial period of 24 months, with an option to extend for a further period of 24 months, in 12 months increments, subject to performance. This will take the maximum framework period to 48 months, ending no later than 17.1.2024.

Title: Framework Arrangement for the Provision of Drainage Maintenance Services
Description: North Lincolnshire Council is inviting tenders from suitably qualified suppliers for a framework arrangement for the provision of drainage maintenance services. Services include provision of drain, culvert and sewer cleaning and cleansing, collection and removal of flood water and CCTV surveys. Further information is available to download from the Tender documents available to download at http://www.yortender.co.uk. The deadline for the submission of tenders is 12 noon 15.6.2017.
